Summary: Block and half walk to the sand.  Sea breeze is nice .bRoom comfortable microwave mini fridge everything you need. Older motel but well kept. You can't go wrong with 777 motel if you don't need all the frills that a big hotel offer. Woody's across the street great burgers.

Summary Heading: Unsafe for family, single women, minorities
Summary: I am a RN and use to stay at this Hotel because it was cheap and conveniently located near the beach and shops, although my last visit, I was locked out of my hotel due to their broken lock.   Since I was the only small framed person to fit through the window, I had to climb through the window and overextended my shoulders because of that incident. While inside I was locked in because of the faulty door lock and couldn’t get out.   A Very traumatizing incident trapped and locked in.    Hotel has residents living there that may have mental issues and abuse drugs. One resident continues to yell out derogatory outburst that involve racial slurs and very hurtful and frightening.   Almost stepped on a dirty needle syringe in the parking lot and I have seen dirty syringes on the

Summary Heading: Worst Hotel I ever stayed at
Summary: Terrible and rude staff, blood on towels, bed was not comfy and had stains, shower had calcium built up. This place needs to be destroyed and make a new hotel and This Hotel needs to be torn down. Beware the hotel is trash and dangerous for travelers. Don't come here.

Summary Heading: Travelers beware this is a "000" facility
Summary: Absolute triple "000" dump! No microwave in room, no cable TV, an angry, desperate, uncaring owner, shady characters roaming about and, overall, a very unsettling and uncomfortable vibe. The 2 hotels located a few hundred yards north are a much better option. Go see Paul at the Ocean View hotel, he's very friendly, professional and accommodating. Their rooms are well appointed and they have an ice machine on the first floor. Triple 7 is a Triple 000! Please be sensible and don't waste your money

Dirtiest place I have ever stayed in. The very low price should have ben a clue, Great location near beach. Needs to be torn down. The entire building is rusting and rotting away. Lots of drudged addicts use this place. Beware.
Manager Response: There was a period where the management was undergoing a maids staffing shortage. There was a shortage of maids.  since then hotel has undergone various renovations. Plus there are now competent maids at your service in there employ.

Summary Heading: Blood, throw up and dirty towels
Summary: Room was so disgusting I wouldn’t let an animal sleep in that. Towels were filthy and yellow. The bathroom floor honestly had what appeared to be dried throw up chunks on the floor. There were clumps not strands clips of hair in the bathroom and the bedroom. Duct tape on the chair as if someone had been tied up. I legit feel like something bad happened in that room. When we told the manager he gave us another key. I wanted so badly to be live him. That the maids missed the room. But the second room had yellow stains on the pillows and blanket. The shower was full of hair and dirt as if it was used to wash something heavily spiked and not rinsed out or washed after. At this point we told the manager it wasn’t possible. I should add that I have severe active Crohn’s. An auto

I booked this room sight unseen as with other victims of online booking sites. I found the smoke detector alarming for batteries, damage to walls with peeled wall paper and drip marks from moisture, dirty carpet, old dirty paint and rags at the landing of the floor, a couple of men eyeing patrons as they entered, a person in need of something other than food and water at the office, a bathroom that was in dire need of a remodel (as well as the rest of the place).  It truly looked like a place that is rented by the hour. I left after spending 5 minutes taking pictures and requested a refund.  Be careful out there!
Room tip: Go to the website of the hotel chain.

Summary Heading: Needed a place for the night
Summary: Room was fine and was a fairly last minute booking, but check in was smooth and simple!  Fairly basic accommodation, although the bathroom was very nice. I stayed in a king room which I got for $66 booking same day, deal was with booking.com  Fine as a place to crash, cheap and cheerful!

Summary Heading: Staff unable to process my booking
Summary: After an 18hr flight from Sydney to LAX and then onto Huntington Beach the hotel reception was unable to process my booking! Accommodation canceled! Too late to make other arrangements, I spent the night on the street! The worst booking ever!
Room tip: Didn't get to see my room

Summary: I borrowed a hairdryer from the front desk last night. I needed to use it in the morning. At 10:30 PM last night, the manager woke us up to demand the hairdryer back. Apparently they only have one to lend out for the entire complex. It was ridiculous. He woke us up!! Additionally, there is no permit posted in the elevator so be careful. They’ve even ripped the phone out of the elevator. Make sure you have your cell phone with you when you board the elevator. Room has been recently painted and remodeled. It was fine.

Standard inn for the money you were paying, quite noisy as being so close to a main road, but a good central location. Efficient and quick check in. We Checked in at 10.45 pm with no hassle. Overall cheap and cheerful!

I made a terrible mistake when I booked this place! I went on line and I only saw the nicest room they had! I never noticed the horrible rest of the motel rooms! I was totally distracted or something to have made this mistake! When we arrived the exterior looked horrible! In need of paint, etc. When we walked in the tiny lobby it smelled terrible!  We asked to view the rooms and 6 of them were horrible! Holes in the wall, wallpaper at least 30 years old and coming off the wall, dirty rug and torn, wood chipped and in need of painting and just awful smell!  We asked why we didn't get the room I saw on line and he said it was $130. for one night when I thought it was the one I booked for $80.! If all rooms looked that good it would be no problem but to pay $130. after the rest of

Summary Heading: Not a nice place to stay
Summary: Very limited on places to stay, due to air show, should have known better really when they had spare rooms! Would not stay here again, didn’t dare look under the sheets not sure what I would find.  Couldn’t wait for the next morning to leave.

We recently went to this dump! It was recommended by a friend who lives locally because of price. We looked at reviews and most seemed to say it was ok. Upon check in they tried to raise the room price. We argued and got it for the price quoted to us. (They don't take a credit card to hold your room) we asked for a non smoking room but our room smelled like an ashtray with cigarette burns all over the carpet. When we got into the shower it had black mold everywhere! They had used silicone to try to hide it but the mold had overgrown it. Needless to say we left. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

We stopped here looking for a room, we were shown two, both had a funky odor, looked way outdated, think 1970's, and was given a cash only price, huh? Makes me think they are not paying the TOT taxes to the city. For sure, they are not doing anything to the rooms. It wasn't for us.....

Summary Heading: I don't know if its average, but it isn't poor either
Summary: My soon to be husband and I spent a night here this past weekend. We both agreed that from the outside it looked like a pretty decent hotel, but looks can be deceiving. This hotel is in need of a huge renovation, at least, I think so. The carpet in the room was dirty, I wore my flip flops when I moved around the room, my fiance wore his socks. The bed for the most part was pretty comfortable, but, I think I tossed and turned most of the night and my fiance noticed the mirror on the ceiling (though I have to say that was kind of fun...I've never stayed in a room with a mirror on the ceiling). We planned to stay two nights, but, I wasn't comfortable, so we stayed just one night. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room wasn't ready and while I waited in the lobby, there

For what I paid for the room, I expected a little better. The heater unit on the air conditioner didn't work so a small space heater was brought in and this got the room warm. The room was a little small but it was comfortable. There was a flat screen tv and a good wifi signal. The bathroom could have been a little cleaner. I didn't want to try and take a shower.

Not worth it, I've done many hotels with similar rates along my trip in California. I can tell you, don't go there ! Shower are nasty. The sheet had few spots. There was paint on furniture ! There was also sign and drawing on the wall ! The owner try to erase it from the wall, but we can still see it. I stayed at the motels 1 one, because it was on my way and it was very late and i would never stay there any longer. I could not wait to leave this place. On positive point, the bed was confortable.

Stopped here late at night as just arrived and all other hotels were full,staff friendly, no ice machine,basic i bed and shower,no fle bites either, not place here to stay too long, think it's a bit seedy and does 2 hour stays!!! Thanks for turcs and dons nearby and cafe opposite for breakfast

This place had a comfortable bed, was in a relatively safe area, very close to Huntington Beach or Long Beach, almost in the middle. The Decor was horrible, the owner was very nice. I called to book the reservation and he gave me a cheaper deal. I took a can of Lysol just in case I needed it, and I did. The carpet was kind of dirty which was the worst part. Everyone was nice. Just could be cleaner. It's so well priced we were ok with it, we didn't mind spending our money on eating and sight seeing. It's great for budget travel.

I've been staying here 2 to 3 times a year for the last 10 years and I love the hospitality and the rooms are kept up and nice. Management is wonderful and accommodating. Whoever complains about this place is a self-contained and is pretentious. Daimon sushi is the best sushi restaurant. I've been to over 30 different sushi restaurants all over LA and IE and I will always come back to Daimon. Don the Beachcomber is also a wonderful place and the vibe is real with down to earth people and the reggae Sundays are the best. Taco Surf down the road had the biggest and best tacos.

We happened upon this place without reservation. Rooms were inexpensive and fairly clean. The decor in the bathroom was dated but clean. The staff were nice. The lady manager was very helpful. There are some nice diners and bars nearby. Stayed here for three nights. Would recommend if you're looking for a budget room in Huntington Beach.  This place is quite near the beach.

Summary Heading: Way better than the Oceanview Hotel
Summary: Staff was super helpful and friendly! Great location near wonderful restaurants and a few great bars with the ocean less than 5 minutes away! Will definitely be back soon with family and friends to enjoy the fun and the sun.

Hi i am Neil . me and my girl spent four weekends at 777 motel for the cost only . on the beach only three rows away , the price was right . how ever ; as other reviews state there are issues ..... bring your own tv remote ,any wires ,conections possible for dvd ,also portable dish tv reciever ...no tv to speak of ..you know  one hbo ..one sport ch ect.....nothing local no news ect ...well ventalited (beach yaknow) clean linon 'our bed was comrortable (hard as i like) dirty carpet yes  ...  out dated interier you bet .... the worst was the plumbing ...off season no hot water ...third floor room  .. shower hard to use (i am a plumber)  as i said / old girl needs work  ..the hilton it is not ..too quaint for that  ...still my hope is thy resasate this old girl to modern ,old

While at this hotel, I had the honor of listening to a business transaction between a guest and a hooker. This included said hooker getting slapped. Faulty wiring in room, dodgy looking mirrors, bathroom tile that looked like Burger King, etc. etc. Cheap, at $50 or so a night, decent location but craptastic otherwise.  Oh, we awoke at 7 am or so because someone used a key to enter our room... but the chairs in front of the door detered them. No bueno.

I have to say that I am surprised by all the negative reviews of this motel posted here. Just to confirm this review is for the 777 Motor Inn on PCH in Sunset Beach/Huntington Beach. Overall the location is OK, but for people on the road, like us, it was very good. It is located right on the PCH, but in the nice community of Sunset Beach and in the third row from the beach. There are plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance. This is an old motel so one can’t expect anything special. We stayed here for a couple of nights and needed this motel to park our car, take a shower and sleep in a clean environment. This motel gave us everything we needed. Our room was on the main floor, close to the reception and facing the highway. Even though it is facing the PCH the room

Stayed for one night, never to be repeated. Wanted reasonable priced motel, don't even think this was to be honest. Motel was grubby, smelly and staff were quite bizarre. Dodgy mirror on ceiling, lights in bathroom didn't work. We slept in our clothes and dare not even attempt a shower. The only plus point was that Don the Beachcomber was next door - we spent 6 hours there before we built up the nerve to go back to 777 (much alcohol was consumed!)  Stay away, you have been warned!
This is the single worst motel i've ever experienced. We chose it for its location, but endes up grossed out by the complete lack of cleanliness and service. Do not stay there!

Stay away. Do not stay here.  It is a reason it has the best rate in Huntington / Sunset Beach area. We  came late. It looked kind of nice when we checked the room, but once we came back from she surf restaurant (which is nice), we did see how dirty the rooms were.   The walls, the roof, the furnitures. Everything was sticky and uncleaned. Carpet was extremely dirty, and layers with dust along the walls and around furnitures was very visiable. The shower and bathroom was so dirty we left without using it.

Summary Heading: We had to get very drunk to be able to sleep here
Summary: Problem 1: location-very noisy and expected once you realize how close you are to PCH Problem 2: although the bed looked clean, the room was dingy and smelled like cigarettes Problem 3: HORRIBLE lighting EVERYWHERE. I felt like I did my makeup by flashlight Problem 4: Remote doesn't match TV and hence can't turn on TV Problem 5: Instead of ON switch on TV, there was a giant hole Problem 6: you need a PHD to figure out how to use the shower controls or at a the very least a wrench Problem 7: romance cannot happen in a room like this unless you're Charles Bukowski  In a pinch, you can stay here and be fine.  However, the room was so depressing we literally had to drink to the point of passing out before returning to our room Why did we stay here? We didn't want to drink and drive

Summary Heading: quiet, clean, nice staff, perfect spot
Summary: again, i stayed here, this year three nights. very quiet, (and i was in between two long term tennants)  clean room, no problems, great price, right near lovely beach access at andersen street, great food choices, perfect blue skies, a nice person at fro nt desk (teresa). i will stay here again. and i should say that i've been at places three times more expensive with many problems that i've never had here... i love the 777...

I am a younger guy.  A younger guy who has lived in college houses with 5 guys at once.  I can honestly say this was the most disgusting room I've ever seen, smelled, or slept in.  I wouldn't even walk around without my shoes on.  It smelled so bad (rotten smoke, carpet from the 60's, hooker sweat) that I never got used to it.  I woke up and could still smell it.  I mean....damn dude.  This place was unbelievable nasty.   I just shuddered thinking about the carpet.  You might save a couple dollars, but you'll re-spend that on new clothes after you burn the ones you wore in this craphole.

Been staying here for years. Nothing fancy, a bit older, but good basic accommodation for weekend digs right across PCH (Pacific Coast Highway) from Sunset Beach. (Think Motel 6 with salt spray.) TacoSurf restaurant is right across the street. Katin's surf shop, one of the last authentic surf shops in SoCal, is right next door. Daimon japanese restaurant right next door on the other side has great sushi. The best breakfast on the West Coast, Harbor House Cafe', is a short walk south on PCH and cross at the light, ( which is the normal route to the beach). Huge portions.  And further south the bars and restaurants in Sunset are what I think of when I remember SoCal beach bars. Walk through the access ways behind Harbor House and your on a great beach. Think there's a kayak rental

i have stayed threr three times, over a 4 year period. i never had a problem. a business nearby,whom i contacted to get their opinion,said ridiculous things about 777. i stayed there anyways, i slept well, the place was clean, no noise,great views of the ocean and wetlands from top floor, it had a elevator, and it had a cool look to the place. it's getting on in years, but you can tell that it was beautiful when new. it has elaborate art-deco style designs  about. and,i know it sounds strange, but the bathrooms are elegantly cool... even the stairs and landings had a neat elegant design,which you don't see in these new style motels. anyways, it's location is perfect, an easy walk to beautiful and uncrowded sunset beach,where you can enjoy a perfect california day. also, thre's
